      • reportsButton

        private javafx.scene.control.Button reportsButton
        Adds Appointments to the Appointment table on screen and in the database. Uses a Lambda function in the consumer, that is passed to the AppointmentDetails Controller. (Justification for Lambda ???)

      • addCustomer

        void addCustomer()
          throws java.io.IOException
        Adds Customers to the Customer table on screen and in the database. Uses a Lambda function in the consumer, that is passed to the AppointmentDetails Controller. (Justification for Lambda ???)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • deleteAppointment

        void deleteAppointment()
        Deletes appointments from Tables on screen and in the database. Verifies if user wants to delete appointment, if false no deletion occurs. Validates that an appointment has been selected, if no appointment is selected alerts user and does nothing. Attempts to delete appointment from database, if unable to alerts user, and returns. If all checks pass, appointment is removed from on screen table.

      • deleteCustomer

        void deleteCustomer()
        Deletes customer from Tables on screen and in the database. Verifies if user wants to delete customer, if false no deletion occurs. Validates that a customer has been selected, if no customer is selected alerts user and does nothing. Validates if a customer has 1+ appointments, this is using a lambda function.* If it is able to delete all appointments with the Customer ID, then removes them from the on screen table using a lambda function.* Then attempt to delete customer from table, if success removes customer from on screen table. *The lambda functions are used for clarity and readability. They check appointments customer id against the customer to be deleted.

      • switchCalendarDuration

        void switchCalendarDuration()
        Switches the calendar duration. Uses a Lambda function as the predicate to the filtered appointments list.

      • updateAppointment

        void updateAppointment()
                throws java.io.IOException
        Initializes the AppointmentDetails view, with an appointment to be updated.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • updateCustomer

        void updateCustomer()
             throws java.io.IOException
        Initializes the CustomerDetails view, with a customer to be updated.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • initialize

        void initialize()
        Initializes the Calendar view. Sets the Current Date Label, initializes the Appointment, and Customer tables. Then sets the visibility of the Appointment Table to the default filter.

      • initializeData

        public void initializeData​(User user)
        Initializes Data. Sets the current user of the application. Loads Customers and Appointments. Validates if there is an appointment with in the next 15 minutes.
        Parameters:
        user - User which has successfully logged into the Calendar Application.

      • hasUpcomingAppointment

        private Appointment hasUpcomingAppointment()
        Checks to see if there is an upcoming appointment within the next 15 minutes.
        Returns:
        first appointment that is with 15 minutes, or a new blank appointment.

      • initializeCustomerTable

        private void initializeCustomerTable()
        Initializes the Customer Table.

      • initializeAppointmentTable

        private void initializeAppointmentTable()
        Initializes the Appointments table.

      • isConflict

        private boolean isConflict​(Appointment result)
        Checks to see if the Appointment has a conflict with an existing appointment.
        Parameters:
        result - result from the Appointments Detail Screen.
        Returns:
        true if there is an appointment that overlaps start or end times., otherwise false.

      • loadCustomers

        private void loadCustomers()
        Loads Customers from the database.

      • loadAppointments

        private void loadAppointments()
        Loads Appointments from the database.
